body:
`miniconda[23]` provide overlapping commands and should not both be `module loaded` simultaneously.

I'd like to avoid user-foot-shooting and disallow this.

Lmod has a [conflict](http://lmod.readthedocs.io/en/latest/050_lua_modulefiles.html) command that might be useful, but I'm not sure how to get at it from the respective packages.

Spack's [`conflicts`](http://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/packaging_guide.html?highlight=setup_environment#conflicts) seems to address other issues (build time) and I don't think that it's relevant.

Is there a standard way to express this relationship in a package and get it into the modulefiles?

Thanks!
title: Is there a way to keep miniconda2 and miniconda3 from being loaded simultaneously
